body.p: The undersigned would represent that at the August term 1864 of the montgomery circuit court he was fined $50 & costs for selling liquor to a minor -- The undersigned now is & at the time of the selling of the liquor to the minor was a regular licensed tavern keeper in mt sterling authorized to vend liquors by retail The minor to whom the liquor was sold was Howard Barnes who is man grown & looked to be twenty one years of age -- but as it appears was actually under that age. but he did not know it & if he had known it would not have sold the liquor to him. Sept 24th 1864
The undersigned citizens of mt. Sterling & montgomery county concur in the above petition & ask the remission of the fine of Mr Wilson:

Samuel McKee
J. D. Reid
Thos. Turner
B. A. Seaver
J H Trimble
J H Cromwell
P. C. Bedford S.M.C.
I sign this on the ground that Mr Wilson had his house burned down by ^the rebels^ & is a poor man & a good citizen, so considered.
This is respectfully submitted and I could only ask that the Same be considered as a deserving case where Executive Clemency could be safely exercised

Montgomery Cir Ct
vs
John Wilson
$50
Remitted
6th Dec/64
